rev.desc.rev.desc: update panel init.code & check.format, set select fields for code
AGMRQ10H53160
Support 9.63 upgrade utility
Store language in the field of upgradeobjects for format
AGMRQ10H47281
Reduce the number of records built into custom upgrade package for normal upgrade utility (for 9.3x and 9.4x).
Only export upgraded data into custom upgrade package for lightweight upgrade from SM9.5x
Print the ignore information into the detail.log in the build folder
AGMRQ10H38236 QCRQ1E110009
Optimize the upgrade tool - part 2
Create lightweight upgrade utility
Build upgrade objects filtered by upgrade results for create customer upgrade
Upgrade Utility: Support SM9.60 upgrade
Set the format object name to output detail.log
Upgrade Utility: Support SM9.60 upgrade
Update the base version to 9.30
Update information in UI when execute upgrade task
Some records are missed in Upgrade Utility
Build upgrade utility with changed records using SM7.10 as baseline version
Optimized upgrade log during creating custom package.
Modified panel : code.format, start, start.code.loop.
there are lot of 'kept customer' records for object 'help' after upgrade to 9.32 with language
Search signatures of format for suffix and prefix of syslanguage
$L.send.sql="object.type=\"format\" and (object.name=\""+name in $L.file+syslanguage in $L.file+"\" or object.name=\""+syslanguage in $L.file+name in $L.file+"\")"
Panel: start.code.loop
Missing supported language codes (e.g. zh-Hans)... rebuilt construction of $L.send.sql to be:
$L.send.sql="object.type=\"format\" and object.name=\""+name in $L.file+syslanguage in $L.file+"\""
... this avoids using hard-coded language codes to construct the query.
Also added new decision panel called "decide.check.format"
so that code formats only checked if syslanguage is "en".
Panel: start.code.loop
Change to add more supported languages
Modification made for CenterPoint Request 37109 Task 32931.
Two problems:
1) The signatures for the Italian formats were not being picked up.
2) Spanish was added as a language in SC6.1.
To correct this, the first line on panel start.code.loop was changed
from

$L.send.sql="object.type = \"format\" and (object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"en\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"de\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"fr\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"ja\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"itil\")"
to

$L.send.sql="object.type = \"format\" and (object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"en\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"de\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"fr\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"ja\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"itil\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"it\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"es\")"

AGMRQ10H53160
Support 9.63 upgrade utility
Store language in the field of upgradeobjects for format

AGMRQ10H38236 QCRQ1E110009
Optimize the upgrade tool - part 2
Create lightweight upgrade utility
Build upgrade objects filtered by upgrade results for create customer upgrade

Set the format object name to output detail.log

there are lot of 'kept customer' records for object 'help' after upgrade to 9.32 with language
Search signatures of format for suffix and prefix of syslanguage
$L.send.sql="object.type=\"format\" and (object.name=\""+name in $L.file+syslanguage in $L.file+"\" or object.name=\""+syslanguage in $L.file+name in $L.file+"\")"
Panel: start.code.loop
Missing supported language codes (e.g. zh-Hans)
Panel: start.code.loop
Change to add more supported languages
Modification made for CenterPoint Request 37109 Task 32931.
Two problems:
1) The signatures for the Italian formats were not being picked up.
2) Spanish was added as a language in SC6.1.
To correct this, the first line on panel start.code.loop was changed
from

$L.send.sql="object.type = \"format\" and (object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"en\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"de\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"fr\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"ja\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"itil\")"
to

$L.send.sql="object.type = \"format\" and (object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"en\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"de\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"fr\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"ja\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"itil\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"it\" or object.name=\""+name in $L.file+"es\")"
